%load_ext autoreload

This markdown cell has a special format to define title and summary

Any time you are going to use nbdev always run nbdev_install_git_hooks beforehand to avoid json format of notebook not playing nicely with git.

Like to name notebooks starting with numbers to show progress.

{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

The # export tag means it will get written into the autogenerated .py file.

If you want to takea. look at the export format ahead of time, you can use show_doc()

{% raw %}

say_hello[source]

say_hello(to)

Say hello to somebody

{% endraw %}

Test your new function

{% raw %} 
say_hello("Sarah")

'Hello, Sarah!'
{% endraw %}

You can include a picture int he documentation

{% raw %} 
from IPython.display import display,SVG
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
display(SVG('<svg height="100"><circle cx="50" cy="50" r="40"/></svg>'))
{% endraw %}

You can also include tests in teh documentation

{% raw %} 
assert say_hello("Jeremy")=="Hello, Jeremy!"
{% endraw %}

Now, create the python files by running nbdev_build_lib in the directory. This wont work if anythign is wrong in settings.ini.

Now work on index.ipynb, start by importing the name of the library you put in setings.ini

Add a class

{% raw %}

class HelloSayer[source]

HelloSayer(to)

Say hello to to using say_hello

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

HelloSayer.say[source]

HelloSayer.say()

Do the saying

{% endraw %}
